Class AudioManagerFactory

java.lang.Object
tage.audio.AudioManagerFactory
public class AudioManagerFactory extends Object
This class is a Factory for creating audio manager objects -- that is, objects which implement the IAudioManager interface. Audio Manager implementation classes can register themselves as being available by invoking registerAudioManager(String, Class). Client classes can obtain a AudioManager implementation instance by invoking createAudioManager(String), providing a String giving the particular AudioManager's class name. The code for this class comes from the RendererFactory class in sage.renderer created by John Clevenger, and it has been reworked by Kenneth Barnett to create audio managers.
Author:
John Clevenger, Kenneth Barnett Modified from the SAGE Audio package for the RAGE game engine by Juan E. Ruiz.

    • registerAudioManager

      public static void registerAudioManager(String audioMgrName, Class<?> audioMgrClassObject)
      Registers a audio manager class (that is, a class implementing the IAudioManager interface) and making the audio manager available to clients.
      Parameters:
      audioMgrName - - a String giving the AudioManager class name
      audioMgrClassObject - - a Class object defining the AudioManager implementation

    • createAudioManager

      public static IAudioManager createAudioManager(String audioMgrClassName)
      A factory method (see the Factory Design Pattern) for creating instances of a particular AudioManager (that is, an object which implements the IAudioManager interface.
      Parameters:
      audioMgrClassName - - a String giving the desired AudioManagers's class name (including any prefixes defining the AudioManagers's subpackage(s)
      Returns:
      - an instance of the specified AudioManager class
